courseDescription: Welcome to the Frontend Development course! In this course, you will learn the fundamental concepts of frontend web development using HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and React. HTML is the backbone of the web, and you will start by learning its syntax and semantics. You will then move on to CSS, where you will learn how to style your HTML pages with colors, fonts, and layouts. Next, you will dive into JavaScript, where you will learn the fundamentals of programming and how to create interactive web pages. Finally, you will learn about React, a popular JavaScript library used for building dynamic user interfaces. You will learn how to create reusable components, manage application state, and work with APIs. Throughout the course, you will complete a series of hands-on projects that will give you real-world experience building websites and web applications. You will also have the opportunity to collaborate with other students and receive feedback on your work. By the end of the course, you will have a strong foundation in frontend web development and be able to create dynamic, responsive, and engaging web pages and web applications using HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and React.

subTitles: What is frontend and need of it?
Understanding Div/Span, Classes/IDs, Semantic Tags, Types of Input tags, typography tags, etc.
CSS centering, CSS float, and clear
Bootstrap layouts like Cards, Carousels, etc.
DOM, getElementById, innerHTML, innerText, changing attributes and styles
Popus, Ways to display output, declare, initialize variables, data types, typeof, conditions
Re-declaration using var keyword, ternary operator, Data types, Arithmetic operators, Relational operators - Identical Operator, Truthy and Falsy Values
JS Operators: Logical, Assignment and Bitwise, JS: Var, Let, Const, Block Scope, Global Scope, Gallery Project
Hoisting, Temporal Dead Zone, Loops, and Gallery Project, JavaScript: Hoisting, Temporal Dead Zone, Loops
Strings, String Methods, and examples, Calculator Code: Digits
Array Methods - .filter, .map methods, JavaScript: lter, .reduce, ES6 Syntaxes, Non Primitive Data Type Assignment
Function methods - call, apply and bind, Intro to Asynchronous JS
Pending, Resolve, Reject, .then, .catch, Promise Chaining, Promise.any, Promise.all
Call Stack, Task Queue, Event Loop, Validations, Async Await
Classes getters and setters, Inheritance, JS Validation
What is React and How to build React apps using 'create-react-app'
Folder Structure Components, Types, Features, Nested Components, Fragments
Nesting Components, Grouping Components, Re-using components, SASS, Props
State, setState, One-way data-binding, Virtual DOM
React Rendering Loops, key, React Lifecycle Theory
Hooks - useEffect React: Lifting the State Up, Forms - Controlled Component
Intro to React Router, working with APIs using axios, Routes, Links, SPA, useParams
Dynamic Routes using Params, creating Links using dynamic data, Fallback Route
